perturbation.original_text: This Amendment No. 1 (the “Amendment”), entered into by and between Stremick’s Heritage Foods, LLC (“Heritage”) Premier Nutrition Corporation (“Premier”) is effective as of June 11, 2018 (“Amendment Effective Date”) and amends that certain Manufacturing Agreement between Heritage and Premier dated July 1, 2017 (“Agreement”). Heritage and Premier are each referred to herein as a “Party” and collectively as the “Parties.”
perturbation.changed_text: This Amendment No. 1 (the “Amendment”), entered into by and between Stremick’s Heritage Foods, LLC (“Heritage”) Premier Nutrition Corporation (“Premier”) is effective as of June 11, 2018 (“Amendment Effective Date”) and amends that certain Manufacturing Agreement between Heritage and Premier dated July 1, 2017 (“Agreement”). Heritage and Premier are each referred to herein as a “Party” and collectively as the “Vendors.”
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Parties' is changed to 'Vendors'. It's inconsistent because the agreement initially defines Heritage and Premier as 'Parties,' but later refers to them collectively as 'Vendors.' This creates confusion as to whether the terms are interchangeable, and it opens the agreement to challenges based on inconsistent naming.

perturbation.original_text: During the Term of this Agreement, Premier shall be required to purchase a Minimum Annual Order Volume (“MAOV”) of [***] (“Units”) for the twelve-month period commencing July 1, 2018 and ending June 30, 2019. The MAOV [***] Units for each twelve-month period commencing July 1, 2019 through the end of the Term, contingent upon commercial aseptic production at Heritage’s [***] facility and approval of that facility by Premier by January 1, 2019. For the avoidance of doubt, the six-month period commencing July 1, 2022 and ending December 31, 2022, Premier will be required to purchase [***] (the twelve-month periods and the six-month period are each a “Contract Period”).
perturbation.changed_text: During the Term of this Agreement, Premier shall be required to purchase a Minimum Annual Order Volume (“MAOV”) of [***] (“Units”) for the twelve-month period commencing July 1, 2018 and ending June 30, 2019. The MAOV [***] Units for each twelve-month period commencing July 1, 2019 through the end of the Term, contingent upon commercial aseptic production at Heritage’s [***] facility and approval of that facility by Premier by January 1, 2019. For the avoidance of doubt, the six-month period commencing July 1, 2022 and ending December 31, 2022, Premier will be required to purchase [***] (the twelve-month periods and the six-month period are each a “Trading Window”).
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Contract Period' is replaced with 'Trading Window'. This causes the agreement to be internally inconsistent regarding the designated timeline/period. The contract has established 'Contract Period' in previous sentence, while another sentence replaces it with 'Trading Window'. This inconsistency creates ambiguity, as it is unclear if both of these terms can be used interchangeably.

perturbation.original_text: Except as otherwise specified above in this Amendment, all other terms, conditions and covenants of the Agreement shall remain in full force and effect.
perturbation.changed_text: Except as otherwise specified above in this Amendment, all other terms, provisions and understandings of the Agreement shall remain in full force and effect.
perturbation.explanation: The word 'conditions' is replaced with 'provisions', and 'covenants' with 'understandings'. This creates an internal contradiction because the agreement initially specifies 'terms, conditions and covenants' as binding elements, whereas the modified text refers to 'terms, provisions and understandings'. It becomes ambiguous whether 'conditions,' 'covenants,' 'provisions,' and 'understandings' are synonymous or distinct elements, potentially affecting enforcement and interpretation.
